title: Why do so many rappers die at an early age? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not all rappers die at an early age - if you’re referring to high profile rapper icons like Notorious BIG & TuPac, and now XXX - they were murdered, DMC - murdered….an action that unfortunately comes (sometimes) with the rugged & rebellious nature of rap music (and the envy that follows). Beefs in the rap game go back to the late 70s/early 80s and serve to glamorize nothing in the end. Eazy E or ODB, health issues that may or may not follow any style of musician, Lil Peep just like Bradley Nowell of Sublime…accidental overdose…the life span of a rappers career has most definitely shortened - almost down to 3 years from 5 years (evaluated last year) unless you can sustain under good management and a determined vision (Jay Z, Will Smith, Dr. Dre, Eminem, Redman, Method Man & the rest of Wu-Tang, Drake, etc.) but I would re-phrase to state “why do so many musicians die at an early age?” and the collective answer from all of mentioned suggestions above is “burn out” & “lifestyle”……world tours & label demands will kill you off time and time again…..unless you have a good team and keep your vision at heart. The artist formerly known as Prince passing away is a testament to the demands a musician must undergo to be number 1. Hope that sheds a little light. Keep in mind today’s “new school/emo” rap culture has glorified drug abuse and hard core DIY grind until you hit a billion on YouTube - more than any other artistic culture this generation has witnessed. We’ve lost way too many artists over the past 3–4 years and they are not all rappers. Rest In Peace Chester Bennington, Avvici, XXX, and so many others-
